intro: Leucadendron sessile, commonly known as the coastal sunset leucadendron, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, cone-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. Its flowers, which range in color from yellow to red, bloom in spring and attract various pollinators. Leucadendron sessile is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
